properties.name: Bar Clash
properties.description: Posted by AnnielikesyouGneisenaustrasse 2a 10961 Berlinbeer, kicker, pool, gory decor

properties.name: Beate Uhse Erotik-Museum
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyoujoachimstaler str 4, berlin, germanythis museum is kind of amazing and hilarious and actually more historically interesting than one would think at first. Beate Uhse was an aviatrix who became Germany\'s equivalent of Hugh Hefner after WW2. this museum (which terminates in a BU sex shop) is based on her centuries-spanning collection of erotic art. um, anyway, titter titter. --jacob

properties.name: Beckers Fritten
properties.description: Posted by AnnielikesyouOranienburger Str. 43a. BEST POMMES. you can get \'em with any sauce you want, too! I recommend Thai peanut sauce. --jacob

properties.name: Berliner-Ensemble
properties.description: Posted by AnnielikesyouBrecht\'s theater. still doing Brecht\'s plays and other radical theater. go see "Die Dreigroschenoper", "Mutter Courage", or best yet, the Heiner Mueller version of "Arturo Ui" while you\'re there and make me livid with jealousy! --jacob

properties.name: Billiards
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyousketchy, but cheap. maybe the old East German mafia hang out here.

properties.name: Botanischer Garten
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyouthis saved me from the berlin winter. it makes me happy just to look at the aerial photos. :)

properties.name: Cafe Zapata
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyou For revolutionaries that like art, fire-breathing sculptures, beer, and music

properties.name: Curry 36
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyoumehringdamm 36, berlin, deutschlandthe best currywurst in berlin!!! at least 6 yrs ago, it was the cheapest and best, and my kumpel scott and i would travel halfway across town to U-Bhf Mehringdamm for it. you MUST order "mit Darm"! :) --jacob

properties.name: Dada Falafel
properties.description: Posted by AnnielikesyouLinienstrasse 132. in my personal heaven, st peter hands you a dada-teller upon entering the pearly gates. the combination of textures and flavors, from the savory sauces to the crunchy, freshly deep-fried falafels to the soft eggplant to the fresh, crisp vegetables, is perfect in every way. and it\'s SO CHEAP!!! --jacob

properties.name: Deutsches Theater
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyou schumannstrasse 13a, berlin, germanythe Inszenierungen here blew my mind as to what theater could be. they do a lot of classics - shakespeare, chekhov, schiller - but always in new and exciting ways. --jacob

properties.name: Die Hackeschen Hoefe
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyouone of the classiest Kinos in berlin for foreign/indie films, and lots of neat little shops, and the Hoefe are simply gorgeous with their mosaics and Jugendstil curves. --jacob

properties.name: East Side Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyou some of the most famous pieces of Berlin Wall graffiti art are here. --jacob

properties.name: FU-BEST House
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyou50 Brentanostrasse Berlin, GermanyThis is the program headquarters, where I\'ll take classes, etc.

properties.name: Gedenkstaette deutscher Widerstand
properties.description: Posted by AnnielikesyouStauffenbergstr. 13 -14, berlin, germanyin this museum, i began to understand how different the german view of history - dialectical, flowing, with each historical force impelling later ones - is from ours, with its distinctly delineated periods and its dominating personalities. it\'s also one of the best memorials i\'ve seen to the nazi era and all those who opposed them, from the 1920s to 1945. --jacob

properties.name: Humboldt-Universitaet booksellers
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyouall around the front gates and plaza of the HU are used booksellers. check it. --jacob

properties.name: Jewish Museum
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyou Lindenstraße 9-14, 10969 Berlinsymbolic architecture at its very, very best. the museum is pretty great, too. --jacob

properties.name: Karton-Fritze
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyouseeburger str 13-14, berlin, germanyfor all your shipping and packing needs! wouldja believe it, this seemed to be the only box store in the yellow pages. it\'s worth the trip: a warehouse full of boxes, each of which has an oh-so-german name (like at IKEA, i guess). when i went, they were also selling pickles out of the front office, under the nom-de-plume Guerkenfritze. because they\'re berliners, they do it all with a straight face, too. :) --jacob

properties.name: Mauerpark
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyouthis was probably my favorite spot in my "Kiez". there\'s a lot of history here: the pre-WW2 Nordbahnof, the Wall, the Todesstreife. but now, it is a peaceful place for people to enjoy, sunning themselves, playing music and bocce, swinging on the swings. the wall is still here, covered in inch-thick layers of graffiti art. you can see the Fernsehturm, of course, from a peaceful distance. if you walk north, you come across a petting zoo and eventually a bridge over a half-mile or so of U-Bahn tracks that shows up in a lot of music videos (another of my favorite spots, esp. at night). --jacob

properties.name: Musik unter den Gleisen
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyousomewhere around here is Musik unter den Gleisen (Friedrichstr. 128 - the map can\'t find it for some reason), the very best used and new music store in Berlin. I can easily drop EUR 100 in a visit (and their CDs are cheap!) and almost regret it later. --jacob

properties.name: Treptower Park
properties.description: Posted by Annielikesyou a wonderful place to picnic and spend a warm weekend day with friends. also, there\'s a big hulkin\' soviet monument. --jacob
